commits.subject: fix(conventions): replace internal jargon with plain language
commits.body:
The convention text is given to external AIs that have no knowledge of
Graphiki internals. Replaced "node" with "item" and "arc" with
"connection" throughout the naming rules. In the JSON format section,
kept the JSON field names ("nodes", "arcs") but introduced them with
plain language ("Each item in the 'nodes' array", "Each connection in
the 'arcs' array") so the AI understands what the fields represent.

commits.subject: refactor(conventions): remove deduplication section, keep alias rule
commits.body:
The DEDUPLICATION section conflated two concerns: cross-import dedup
(handled by mergeService, not controllable by the AI generating the
file) and within-file dedup (basic AI competence, not worth spelling
out). Removed the section entirely. The one non-obvious case — alias
merging when source data uses multiple names for the same entity —
is now a bullet under TITLES where it logically belongs.

Tags: conventions, naming, cleanup

Urgency: 1
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: conventions
Semver: patch

commits.title: remove deduplication section, keep alias rule

commits.subject: feat(conventions): add strict naming and consistency rules for imports
commits.body:
Extracted a shared NAMING_CONVENTIONS block appended to both JSON and
Markdown convention content. The rules are prescriptive enough that two
independent AI sessions given the same real-world data should produce
identical titles, labels, arc titles, and property keys — enabling
reliable duplicate detection by the merge service.

Key additions:
- Title rules: most widely recognized name, no legal suffixes, no
  honorifics, no abbreviations unless the acronym IS the common name
- Label rules: singular PascalCase, standard vocabulary of 19 common
  labels, broad-over-narrow preference
- Arc title rules: lowercase verb phrases, active voice, present/past
  tense distinction, standard vocabulary of 26 common relationships
- Property rules: camelCase keys, standard vocabulary, typed values
  (real numbers, booleans, ISO dates, arrays instead of CSV strings)
- Deduplication guidance: reuse IDs for same entity, merge aliases,
  no duplicate arcs

Tags: conventions, naming, consistency, import, merge
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: conventions
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_01TqYv4V9ccQCb5F6ZhnubYn
commits.title: add strict naming and consistency rules for imports

commits.subject: fix(ui): detail drawer opens on click, timeline dots aligned on line
commits.body:
Two bugs fixed:

1. Detail drawer never opened when clicking a node or arc. Root cause:
   cy.on('tap', handleTapBackground) fires on ALL taps, including
   bubbled events from nodes and edges. The background handler cleared
   the selection immediately after the node handler set it. Fix: check
   evt.target === cy before clearing selection.

2. Timeline marker dots were positioned ~15px to the right of the
   vertical track line. Root cause: negative margin math was incorrect
   under box-sizing: border-box (margin-left: -22px produced a dot
   center at 24px, but the line center is at 9px). Fix: switch to
   absolute positioning (left: -25px) for precise geometric alignment.

Tags: ui, graph-canvas, timeline, event-handling, css
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 4
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: polish
Semver: patch
commits.title: detail drawer opens on click, timeline dots aligned on line

commits.subject: fix(quality): resolve 16 best-practice and convention issues
commits.body:
Critical bugs:
- mergeService: fix arc inclusion logic (|| → &&) — arcs with one dangling
  endpoint were incorrectly included in merge results
- mergeService: remove unused _existingArcs parameter from buildMergeProposal
- useConventions: fix nested timeout leak on unmount + add save error handling

High (CLAUDE.md rule violations):
- ConnectNodeModal: move inline styles to CSS classes (connect-modal,
  modal-list-item.selected, modal-list-item-labels)
- ContextMenu: replace document.querySelector anti-pattern with useRef
- graphService: wrap emit() listener calls in try/catch to prevent one
  failing listener from breaking all subscribers
- Add :focus-visible styles on buttons, context menu items, modal list
  items, view switcher tabs, and timeline entries

Medium:
- App.tsx + DetailPanel.tsx: add try/catch with user-friendly error messages
  to all async operations (create, connect, duplicate, delete, save)
- Remove dead CSS classes (.modal-list-item-warning, .create-node-properties,
  .create-node-checkbox)
- Add --color-success/--color-success-hover CSS variables, replace hardcoded
  #059669/#047857 in btn-update
- Fix mobile touch targets below 44px for context-menu-item, modal-list-item,
  app-tab

Low:
- GraphCanvas: extract 11 magic numbers into named constants
- DebugPill.css: fix low-contrast text (#475569 → #64748b) for WCAG AA
- graphService: bulkDeleteNodes emits single data:changed instead of N
  individual events

Tags: quality, best-practice, conventions, bugfix, accessibility

Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid
Epic: quality-audit
Semver: patch

commits.subject: fix(ui): resolve 7 UX/UI issues found during review
commits.body:
1. Node labels unreadable: Changed Cytoscape node label color from
   #1f2937 (near-black) to #e2e8f0 (light gray) so text is readable
   on the dark #0f172a canvas background.

2. btn-small class mismatch: DetailPanel used "btn-small" but CSS only
   defines "btn-sm". Renamed to btn-sm so property editor buttons
   (+ Add, ×) render with correct compact sizing.

3. Dead CSV CSS removed: Deleted ~110 lines of unused .import-csv-*
   and .csv-mapper-* styles left over from CSV import removal during
   Product Realignment.

4. Mobile menu touch-close: Added touchstart listener alongside
   mousedown so the hamburger dropdown closes when tapping outside
   on touch-only mobile devices.

5. Context menu off-screen: Added viewport bounds checking via ref
   callback that adjusts left/top when the menu would overflow the
   right or bottom viewport edge.

6. Arc creation UI: Added ConnectNodeModal with searchable node picker
   and optional relationship name. Accessible via "Connect to..." in
   the right-click/long-press context menu. Creates directed arc from
   source to selected target. Updated tutorial step 2 to reference
   the new connection flow.

7. Stale comment: Fixed App.tsx comment that still referenced
   "Upload/Query/Graph/Conventions" tabs (only Graph/Conventions exist).

Tags: ui, ux, accessibility, arc-creation, cleanup
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid
Epic: polish
Semver: minor

commits.subject: feat(import): add merge review with duplicate/conflict detection
commits.body:
Phase 4 of the product realignment: import rework with merge system.

New files:
- mergeService.ts: Pure-function merge engine. Matches imported nodes
  to existing by normalized title. Categorizes as new/duplicate/conflict.
  Duplicate = same title+labels+content+properties. Conflict = same title,
  different data. Generates per-item property diffs. getApprovedItems()
  remaps IDs for conflict overwrites and filters accepted items.
- MergeReview.tsx + CSS: Three collapsible sections (New, Already Exists,
  Changed). Per-item checkboxes. Accept/Skip All bulk toggles. Property
  diffs shown inline for conflicts. Non-technical language throughout.
- mergeService.test.ts: 14 tests covering proposal building, status
  categorization, ID remapping, and count helpers.

ImportModal changes:
- Flow now: Upload → Parse → Merge Review → Import → Done
- CSV import removed (spec focuses on markdown from AI preprocessing)
- Visual preview step removed (merge review provides sufficient info)
- Merge review replaces direct-to-persist flow

Deleted files:
- CsvColumnMapper.tsx: No longer needed without CSV import
- ImportPreviewCanvas.tsx: No longer needed without visual preview step

Build: passes (tsc + vite)
Tests: 192/192 passing (11 test files)

Tags: phase-4, import, merge-review, duplicate-detection
Complexity: 4
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid
Epic: product-realignment
Semver: minor

commits.title: add merge review with duplicate/conflict detection

commits.subject: refactor(core): migrate from schema-based to label-based data model
commits.body:
Replace the schema/type system with a simpler label-based model.
This is Phase 1 (Data Model Foundation) and Phase 2 (Layout Restructure)
of the product realignment plan.

Key changes:
- GraphNode/Arc use labels[] instead of typeId/tags
- Removed SchemaBlueprint, NodeType, ArcType, PropertyDefinition types
- Added ConventionRules type and AppTab union for tab navigation
- Database v2: dropped schemas table, renamed tag indexes to label indexes
- Factory functions simplified: removed createSchema, createNodeType, etc.
- Query engine uses label: prefix instead of type:/tag:
- Import/export uses 2-param exportToJson (no schemas), 1-param resolveMarkdownImport
- Snapshot service uses 2-param takeSnapshot (no schemas)
- useAppMode returns {activeTab, setActiveTab} instead of mode/schema state
- useGraphData simplified: no includeSystem parameter
- App.tsx rewritten with tab-based navigation (no designer/user mode)
- Removed: schema components, DesignerPanel, ConnectModal, KanbanView,
  ListView, TableView, ViewBuilder, ViewConfigEditor
- Graph coloring uses label-hash-based palette instead of schema types
- All 166 tests pass, lint clean, build succeeds

Tags: product-realignment, phase-1, phase-2, labels, migration
Complexity: 5
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: high
Debt: paid
Epic: product-realignment
Semver: major

https://claude.ai/code/session_01MJJT4w8YukfxVmCpcMZeZB
commits.title: migrate from schema-based to label-based data model

commits.subject: feat(import): auto-create unknown types during import
commits.body:
Adds typeResolutionService that post-processes import results to auto-create
missing node types, arc types, and infer property definitions. Runs as pure
functions between parsing and persistence, preserving existing function purity.

Markdown import: `type: Person` in frontmatter now auto-creates a "Person"
NodeType if it doesn't exist. Arc labels ("contains", "links to") become
ArcTypes. Frontmatter keys (role, department, etc.) are inferred as string
PropertyDefinitions on auto-created types.

JSON import: Optional `typeName` field on nodes/arcs enables name-based type
resolution (extracted as hints in ImportResult, keeping GraphNode clean).
Valid typeId takes precedence over typeName.

When no schema is active, a new schema is created (named after the import
file) and set as active. Undo import restores the previous active schema.

ImportModal shows informational banner about auto-created types in the
visual preview step before the user approves.

Tags: import, types, schema, auto-creation, type-resolution
Complexity: 4
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: neutral
Epic: markdown-import
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_01DVdJxFenUrMeuYYuHvXis6
commits.title: auto-create unknown types during import

commits.subject: docs(guide): add naming conventions and type handling guidance
commits.body:
Adds three new sections to the AI research output guide:

- Naming conventions: exact consistency rules, Title Case recommendation,
  no abbreviation mixing, wiki-link matching, no trailing punctuation.
  Explains that no format auto-merges duplicates and cross-import
  deduplication does not exist.

- Type assignment (per format): types must pre-exist in the active
  schema, unknown types are not auto-created, only use type: when user
  specifies their schema types. JSON typeId requires exact schema IDs.
  CSV type assignment happens via UI dropdown.

- Connection naming (JSON): consistent labels, consistent direction,
  clear inverse pairs, short lowercase labels.

Also updates the quick reference table for type assignment accuracy.

Tags: docs, import, ai-workflow, naming, types

Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: neutral

commits.subject: docs: add AI research output guide for all import formats
commits.body:
Guide document designed to be pasted into AI assistant context
(ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) so research output can be imported directly
into Graphiki. Covers all three supported formats with exact syntax,
rules, templates, and real-world examples:

- Markdown: headings as items, hierarchy, wiki-links, YAML frontmatter
- JSON: versioned envelope with nodes, arcs, custom relationship labels
- CSV: flat item lists with tags and custom properties

Includes format selection decision table and quick reference matrix.

commits.subject: feat(import): add heading hierarchy to markdown import
commits.body:
All headings (h1-h6) now become nodes instead of only h1. Heading
depth creates parent-child "contains" arcs (e.g., h2 under h1 gets a
"contains" arc from h1 to h2). Wiki-links still create "links to" arcs.

Added setext frontmatter artifact detection to filter fake h2 headings
that remark generates from post-heading YAML blocks. Updated tutorial
modal step 5 to mention markdown import. Created comprehensive format
documentation at docs/markdown-import-format.md.

Tags: markdown, import, hierarchy, parser, docs

commits.subject: feat(import): add markdown import with wiki-link arc creation
commits.body:
Add markdown import support to the import modal. Users can upload .md files
or paste markdown text directly. H1 headings become nodes, [[wiki-links]]
become arcs, and optional YAML frontmatter sets tags/type/properties.

Hybrid parsing approach: remark AST for reliable heading detection (ignores
# in code blocks), raw text slicing for section content and section-level
frontmatter (remark misparses post-heading --- as setext h2).

Missing link targets are auto-created as empty nodes with warnings.
Type names in frontmatter are resolved case-insensitively against the
active schema.

Tags: markdown, import, wiki-links, parsing, phase-4

commits.subject: feat(import,selection): add import preview, multi-select, bulk delete, and undo import
commits.body:
Three features addressing data persistence safety and selection UX gaps:

1. Import visual preview: New visual-preview step in ImportModal shows a
   read-only Cytoscape graph with existing items (dimmed) alongside imported
   items (green dashed borders) before persisting. Users approve or cancel.

2. Multi-select & bulk delete: useSelection hook extended with toggleNodeSelection
   and toggleArcSelection for Ctrl/Cmd+click. GraphCanvas detects modifier keys.
   Context menu and DetailPanel show bulk delete when multiple items selected.
   graphService.bulkDeleteNodes cascades arc deletion.

3. Undo import: snapshotService takes an in-memory structuredClone of all
   data before import. Done step shows "Undo Import" button that restores
   workspace via graphService.restoreFromSnapshot using a Dexie transaction.

Tags: import, selection, multi-select, bulk-delete, undo, preview

commits.subject: fix(deploy): set Vite base URL to /graphiki/ for GitHub Pages
commits.body:
GitHub Pages serves this repo at /graphiki/ subpath. Without an
explicit base, Vite defaults to '/' — all asset, icon, and service
worker paths resolve to the site root, causing 404s and a white screen.

Also switches manifest icon src from absolute (/icon.svg) to relative
(icon.svg) so they resolve correctly relative to the manifest URL
under the base path.

Tags: deploy, github-pages, pwa, white-screen

Urgency: 5
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: phase-6-polish
Semver: patch

commits.subject: feat(debug): add alpha-phase debug pill for diagnosing blank-screen issues
commits.body:
Mobile GitHub Pages deployments show a blank white screen with no way
to inspect errors. This adds a floating debug pill (bottom-right corner)
that captures the full app boot sequence, DB init, data loading, PWA
lifecycle, and unhandled errors/rejections in an in-memory event store.

The DebugPill renders in its own React root so it survives App-level
crashes. Two tabs: Log (color-coded event stream) and Environment
(URL, UA, screen, protocol, standalone mode, SW/IDB support). Includes
copy-to-clipboard for sharing debug reports.

Integrated logging points:
- main.tsx: boot sequence, root element, React render
- database.ts: Dexie constructor, IndexedDB ready
- useGraphData.ts: data load start/success/failure
- usePWAUpdate.ts: SW registration success/failure

Tags: debug, alpha, diagnostics, pwa, mobile
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 4
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: added
Epic: alpha-debug
Semver: minor

commits.subject: fix(review): resolve remaining design issues, add service + hook tests
commits.body:
Design fixes:
- deleteNode now emits arc:deleted for each cascade-deleted arc instead
  of silently bulk-deleting. Collects arc IDs first, then deletes and
  emits per-arc events so arc-specific listeners stay consistent.
- loadAllData now filters system nodes/arcs via getAllNodes/getAllArcs
  instead of raw db.toArray(), preventing system items from leaking
  into the graph canvas and views.
- getAllNodes/getAllArcs changed from .where().equals(0) to .filter()
  for boolean isSystem fields — .equals(0) fails in fake-indexeddb
  which preserves JS booleans instead of coercing to 0/1.
- Analysis panel source/target validated against current filtered nodes
  via derived validSourceId/validTargetId. Stale selections (from nodes
  removed by query filter) are treated as empty, disabling Run button.
- Config changed from eager module-load evaluation to lazy Proxy-based
  access. window.__GRAPHIKI_CONFIG__ is now read on first property access,
  supporting override scripts loaded after the app bundle.

New tests (48 added, 109 → 157):
- graphService: 22 tests covering CRUD, events, cascade delete,
  system filtering, bulk upsert, event unsubscribe
- viewService: 10 tests covering CRUD, events, unsubscribe
- useSelection: 7 tests covering all selection state transitions
- useAppMode: 9 tests covering mode toggle, schema persistence,
  localStorage read/write, null handling

Dev dependency added: fake-indexeddb (in-memory IndexedDB for tests)

Tags: review, bugfix, tests, services, hooks
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: internal
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: quality-review
Semver: patch

https://claude.ai/code/session_018HMdQnMHEiZkN2JkoXuu9E
commits.title: resolve remaining design issues, add service + hook tests

commits.subject: fix(review): fix 4 bugs, 3 cleanups, add 6 tests from 6-phase review
commits.body:
Bug fixes:
- JSON import now uses bulkPut (upsert) instead of add, preventing
  ConstraintError on duplicate IDs when re-importing the same file.
  Added bulkUpsertNodes/Arcs/Schemas to service layer.
- queryResultCount derived from inline queryResult instead of computed
  separately in handleRunQuery callback. Previous approach could show
  a count that didn't match the actually-rendered filtered data when
  nodes/arcs changed between callback run and next render.
- Betweenness centrality normalization corrected from (n-1)*(n-2) to
  (n-1)*(n-2)/2 for undirected graphs. Previous normalization produced
  values 2x too high because each pair is traversed from both directions.

Cleanups:
- Merged duplicate .modal-list-item CSS rule into single declaration.
- Removed unused `arcs` prop from KanbanView, TableView, ViewContainer.

Tests:
- Added 6 tests for autoSuggestMappings (title/name/label mapping,
  tags/labels/categories, ID skipping, schema property matching,
  fallback to lowercase, empty headers).

109 tests passing, lint clean, build clean.

Tags: review, bugfix, cleanup, tests, phase-1-6
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: quality-review
Semver: patch

https://claude.ai/code/session_018HMdQnMHEiZkN2JkoXuu9E
commits.title: fix 4 bugs, 3 cleanups, add 6 tests from 6-phase review

commits.subject: feat(polish): add Phase 6 — code splitting, PWA hardening, config system
commits.body:
Code splitting via Vite manualChunks splits vendor-cytoscape (442KB) and
vendor-core (React, Dexie, markdown) into separate cacheable chunks.
Heavy modals (ExportModal, ImportModal) lazy-loaded with React.lazy().

Large-graph performance guard uses grid layout for 500+ nodes instead of
expensive cose force-directed layout (O(n) vs O(n²)).

PWA hardened with workbox runtime caching, iOS meta tags, and
BeforeInstallPrompt install banner with localStorage dismissal.

App configuration system (config.ts) provides typed defaults overridable
at runtime via window.__GRAPHIKI_CONFIG__ for custom deployments.

Tags: phase-6, performance, pwa, code-splitting, config, distribution
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: polish-distribution
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_018HMdQnMHEiZkN2JkoXuu9E
commits.title: add Phase 6 — code splitting, PWA hardening, config system

commits.subject: feat(analysis): add Phase 5 graph analysis algorithms + visualization
commits.body:
Implements six graph algorithms as pure functions on adjacency lists,
with a collapsible UI panel for running them and visual overlays on
the graph canvas for displaying results.

Algorithms implemented:
- Degree centrality: identifies hub nodes by connection count
- Betweenness centrality (Brandes): finds bridge nodes between clusters
- PageRank (power iteration): ranks nodes by network influence
- Connected components (BFS): partitions graph into disconnected groups
- Shortest path (BFS): finds shortest route between two selected nodes
- Clustering coefficient: measures local triangle density

Visualization:
- Score-based node sizing (30-70px scaled by normalized score)
- Path highlighting with accent color on nodes and arcs
- Component coloring with 10-color palette
- Non-highlighted elements dimmed to 20% opacity
- Cytoscape class-based styling (analysis-dimmed, analysis-highlighted)

UI:
- AnalysisPanel with algorithm dropdown, description, source/target pickers
- Top-20 results table sorted by score
- Path display with arrow notation
- Component count summary
- Collapsible panel (visible only in graph view)

Also removes stale reference to nonexistent docs/EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md.

Test coverage: 103 total (29 new analysis tests covering all algorithms
with star/chain/triangle/disconnected graph fixtures).

Tags: phase-5, analysis, algorithms, centrality, pagerank, pathfinding
Complexity: 4
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: neutral
Epic: analysis-algorithms
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_018HMdQnMHEiZkN2JkoXuu9E
commits.title: add Phase 5 graph analysis algorithms + visualization

commits.subject: feat(import-export): add Phase 4 import/export system + expand test coverage
commits.body:
Implements JSON and CSV import/export with a pure-function service
layer (no DB dependency) for easy testing. JSON exports use a versioned
envelope for future migration. CSV import includes column-to-property
mapping with auto-suggest from schema definitions.

Phase 4 additions:
- importExportService.ts: exportToJson, validateJsonImport, exportNodesToCsv,
  parseCsvString, mapCsvToNodeData, autoSuggestMappings, downloadFile
- ExportModal: format selection (JSON full backup / CSV current view)
- ImportModal: multi-step flow with file upload, JSON preview, CSV column mapping
- CsvColumnMapper: table UI for mapping CSV headers to node fields

Test coverage expansion (74 total, up from 38):
- importExportService.test.ts: 33 tests covering JSON roundtrip, CSV parsing,
  column mapping, validation, edge cases (quoted fields, Windows line endings)
- factory.test.ts: 3 new tests for createView factory

commits.subject: feat(views): add Phase 3 query and view system + Vitest test runner
commits.body:
Implements the full Phase 3 query and view system alongside Vitest
test infrastructure. Query bar filters nodes/arcs with a simple token
syntax (type:X, tag:Y, property:value, title:~term). View switcher
enables toggling between graph, kanban board, list, and table views.
All views consume filtered data from the query engine.

Phase 3 additions:
- Query engine with parseQuery/executeQuery (token-based, AND-combined)
- View service layer (CRUD + events, same pattern as graph/schema)
- QueryBar component with explicit run, clear, result count
- ViewSwitcher with graph/board/list/table tabs
- ViewContainer routing to correct view component
- KanbanView: groupBy enum property, HTML5 drag-drop between columns
- ListView: sortable columns, click-to-select, inline title editing
- TableView: dynamic columns from schema, per-cell editing, sort

Test infrastructure:
- Vitest configured inline in vite.config.ts (jsdom environment)
- 38 tests: factory (10), schemaService (13), queryEngine (15)
- createView factory for ViewConfiguration objects

Urgency: 2

commits.subject: feat(schema): add Phase 2 schema layer — types, builder UI, and schema-aware creation
commits.body:
Implements the full schema layer for Graphiki, enabling structured graph
data through user-defined schemas with node types, arc types, connection
rules, and property definitions.

Service layer:
- schemaService.ts: Schema CRUD, type lookups, connection validation
- factory.ts: Factories for schemas, node types, arc types, properties

Hooks:
- useAppMode: User/designer mode toggle with localStorage persistence
- useSchemaData: Live-updating schema list with event subscription

Schema Builder UI (designer mode):
- SchemaList: Create, edit, delete, activate schemas
- SchemaEditor: Tabbed editor for details, types, and rules
- NodeTypeEditor/ArcTypeEditor: Name, color, properties editing
- PropertyDefEditor: Dynamic property type configuration
- ConnectionRuleEditor: Define valid arc-to-node connections

Schema-aware data creation:
- CreateNodeModal: Type selector + dynamic property form
- ConnectModal: Arc type dropdown with connection rule validation (permissive)

Graph visualization:
- GraphCanvas: Type-based node colors and arc styles via Cytoscape data attributes
- DetailPanel: Type badges, schema-defined property display and editing

App shell:
- Mode toggle button (User/Designer) in header
- Active schema badge display
- Designer mode shows Schema Builder in side panel

Also adds delete confirmation dialogs for destructive actions and
fixes React 19 lint compliance (key-based remounting over useEffect setState).

Tags: schema, types, builder, designer-mode, phase-2
Complexity: 4
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: neutral
Epic: schema-layer
Semver: minor

commits.subject: Add Phase 1 core engine: React + Cytoscape.js graph workspace
commits.body:
Set up the Graphiki project with Vite, React 19, TypeScript, and PWA support.
Implements the core data model (nodes/arcs), IndexedDB persistence via Dexie.js,
Cytoscape.js graph visualization with touch support, split-panel responsive layout,
context menu interactions, and markdown content editing.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: Initial commit
commits.title: Initial commit
